input:
Bob is green. Bob is red. Bob is young. Dave is big. Dave is nice. Dave is red. Erin is nice. Erin is young. Gary is big. Gary is red. Nice, furry people are big. If someone is green and nice then they are red. Nice people are furry. If someone is big then they are furry. Furry people are young. If Dave is nice and Dave is young then Dave is green. All furry, big people are green. Red, furry people are not kind. If Bob is not furry then Bob is young. Question: Erin is not kind.?

universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Green Bob
axiom T2 : Red Bob
axiom T3 : Young Bob
axiom T4 : Big Dave
axiom T5 : Nice Dave
axiom T6 : Red Dave
axiom T7 : Nice Erin
axiom T8 : Young Erin
axiom T9 : Big Gary
axiom T10 : Red Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Furry x → Big x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ Nice x → Red x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Furry x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Furry x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Young x
axiom R6 : Nice Dave ∧ Young Dave → Green Dave
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Big x → Green x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Furry x → ¬ Kind x
axiom R9 : ¬ Furry Bob → Young Bob

theorem erin_is_not_kind : ¬ Kind Erin :=
begin
  sorry,
end
output:
theorem erin_is_not_kind : ¬ Kind Erin :=
begin
  apply R8,
  split,
  apply R2,
  split,
  apply R7,
  split,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R3,
  exact T7,
  exact T4,
  apply R3,
  exact T7,
end

-- The answer is True
